provided for USG-authorized use only. By using this IS (which includes any 
device attached to this IS), you consent to the following conditions:
-The USG routinely intercepts and monitors communications on this IS for 
purposes including, but not limited to, penetration testing, COMSEC monitoring,

-Communications using, or data stored on, this IS are not private, are subject 
to routine monitoring, interception, and search, and may be disclosed or used 
for any USG-authorized purpose.
-This IS includes security measures (e.g., authentication and access controls) 
to protect USG interests--not for your personal benefit or privacy.
-Notwithstanding the above, using this IS does not constitute consent to PM, LE 
or CI investigative searching or monitoring of the content of privileged 
communications, or work product, related to personal representation or services 
by attorneys, psychotherapists, or clergy, and their assistants. Such 
communications and work product are private and confidential. See User 
Agreement for details.

execution_details.stdout:
# sysctl settings are defined through files in
# /usr/lib/sysctl.d/, /run/sysctl.d/, and /etc/sysctl.d/.
#
# Vendors settings live in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/.
# To override a whole file, create a new file with the same in
# /etc/sysctl.d/ and put new settings there. To override
# only specific settings, add a file with a lexically later
# name in /etc/sysctl.d/ and put new settings there.
#
# For more information, see sysctl.conf(5) and sysctl.d(5).
# Per : Set net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_ra = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_ra = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_redirects = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_redirects = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.all.forwarding = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.all.forwarding = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.all.log_martians = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.all.log_martians = 1
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter = 1
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.default.log_martians = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.default.log_martians = 1
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter = 1
# Per : Set net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1
# Per : Set net.ipv4.icmp_ignore_bogus_error_responses = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.icmp_ignore_bogus_error_responses = 1
# Per : Set net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies = 1
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects = 0
# Per : Set net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects = 0
# Per : Set kernel.core_pattern = |/bin/false in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel.core_pattern = |/bin/false
# Per : Set kernel.dmesg_restrict = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel.dmesg_restrict = 1
# Per : Set kernel.kexec_load_disabled = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel.kexec_load_disabled = 1
# Per : Set kernel.perf_event_paranoid = 2 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel.perf_event_paranoid = 2
# Per : Set kernel.unprivileged_bpf_disabled = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel.unprivileged_bpf_disabled = 1
# Per : Set kernel.yama.ptrace_scope = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel.yama.ptrace_scope = 1
# Per : Set net.core.bpf_jit_harden = 2 in /etc/sysctl.conf
net.core.bpf_jit_harden = 2
# Per : Set kernel.randomize_va_space = 2 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel.randomize_va_space = 2
user.max_user_namespaces=0
